tourBios.curYrHigh: Joined PGA TOUR Latinoamérica by finishing T9 at the Sebring, FL Q-School in January. Secured full status for the first half of the season as one of the players who survived a five-man playoff for three spots inside top-11.
tourBios.carHigh:
Played on the NGA Tour in 2012 and 2013. 

2015: Played in 20 Web.com Tour events, making 10 cuts. Had three top 25s - a T17 in Bogota, Colombia, a T18 in the Utah Championship and a T20 at the Greater Dallas Open. Finished 112th on the Regular Season money list and 132nd on the final year-long money lists…Made the cut in four of his first six starts on the Web.com Tour…Drove from the last event, the Chitimacha Louisiana Open, directly to Houston, where he successfully Monday-qualified the next day for the PGA TOUR's Shell Houston Open. In his first TOUR start, opened with 68-69-68 and was T6 going into the final round. A 77, which included bogeys on the last four holes, dropped him to T42. He took home a check for $21,235... Finished T3 at the VISA Open de Argentina on his first of three starts on PGA TOUR Latinoamérica in November.

2014: Finished fifth at PGA TOUR Canada Qualifying School outside Orlando to earn exempt status...Made PGA TOUR Canada debut at the season-opening PC Financial Open, where he finished T7. Was one stroke off the lead through 36 holes after opening 68-66. Closed 72-70 to secure top-10 performance...Closed with rounds of 66-68 to finish T5 at the inaugural Forces and Families Open, three strokes behind champion Greg Machtaler for second top-10 finish...Was 44th in earnings at season's end, making 11 starts...Competed in four Adams Pro Tour events and posted two top-five finishes, including a victory at the Merrill Lynch Open...Finished T35 at Web.com Tour Q-School in December. 

2011: First Web.com Tour start came at the Chitimacha Louisiana Open (missed cut).
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Three-time first-team All-Big South selection at Charleston Southern University.
tourBios.personal: Grew up in Surrey, England…First-tee entrance song would be "Buy me a boat" by Chris Jenson… His wife, Arliss, played college golf at the University of Texas… His uncle, Gareth Hall, played professional soccer for Chelsea and Wales…Favorite book is Lone Survivor, and his favorite athletes are Manu Ginobli and Frank Lampard…Always marks his ball head's up and uses a quarter from the 1960s…Favorite TV show is "Seinfeld," and his biggest thrill in golf was winning his first professional event…Biggest thrill outside golf was getting married…Favorite movies are "Lone Survivor" and "Rush."…Favorite golf course played is TPC Sawgrass' Stadium Course…Would like to trade places with Tony Parker for a day so he can run point in an NBA game…Favorite pro teams are the San Antonio Spurs and Chelsea Football Club…Not many people know he is lefthanded…Personal motto is "Everything happens for a reason."…Is involved with Habitat for Humanity…Twitter name is @day_kelvin... Instagram name is @kelvindaygolf
tourBios.exmtStatus: Exempt - Finished 2-11 at 2016 Q-School (exempt to midseason reshuffle)
Exempt - Finished 11-49 at 2014 Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament (subject to second reshuffle)

His uncle, Gareth Hall, played professional soccer for Chelsea and Wales...Favorite book is Lone Survivor, and his favorite athletes are Manu Ginobli and Frank Lampard...Always marks his ball head's up and uses a quarter from the 1960s...Favorite TV show is "Seinfeld," and his biggest thrill in golf was winning his first professional event...Biggest thrill outside golf was getting married...Favorite movies are "Lone Survivor" and "Rush."...Favorite golf course played is TPC Sawgrass' Stadium Course...Would like to trade places with Tony Parker for a day so he can run point in an NBA game...Favorite pro teams are the San Antonio Spurs and Chelsea Football Club...Not many people know he is lefthanded...Personal motto is "Everything happens for a reason."...Is involved with Habitat for Humanity...Twitter handle is @day_kelvin.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the Web.com Tour was T17th in 2015 at the Colombia Championship Presented by Claro.
